message_1: Suppose we want to encrypt the word "CRYPTOGRAPHY" using a Caesar cipher with a shift of 7. What is the resulting encrypted text?
message_2:
To encrypt the word "CRYPTOGRAPHY" using a Caesar cipher with a shift of 7, we will shift each letter in the word by 7 positions in the alphabet. If the shift goes beyond 'Z', we wrap around to the beginning of the alphabet.

C -> J
R -> Y
Y -> F
P -> W
T -> A
O -> V
G -> N
R -> Y
A -> H
P -> W
H -> O
Y -> F

The resulting encrypted text is "JYFWAVNYHWOF".
